decks.notes: This Bant Aggro deck focuses on using small creatures, such as Llanowar Elves and Merfolk Branchwalker, along with powerful midrange threats like Hydroid Krasis and Jadelight Ranger, to put consistent pressure on the opponent. It also includes cards like Wildgrowth Walker and Trostani Discordant to gain life and stabilize the board. The deck also features some control elements, such as Deputy of Detention and Prison Realm, to deal with problematic cards and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck utilizes a mix of planeswalkers, like Teferi, Time Raveler and Vivien Reid, for additional card advantage and flexibility.

This deck focuses on controlling the board with a mix of removal spells and strong creatures like Jadelight Ranger and Wildgrowth Walker. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by gaining card advantage and utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales. Command the Dreadhorde is used as a finisher to bring back key creatures from the graveyard. The deck also includes some mana fixing lands to ensure smooth gameplay. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the game and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the board with powerful creatures like Jadelight Ranger and Wildgrowth Walker, while utilizing cards like Massacre Girl and Command the Dreadhorde to maintain board presence and disrupt your opponent's strategy. Tamiyo and Teferi provide card advantage and control, while Vraska is great for removal. The deck focuses on mana ramp and fixing with cards like Paradise Druid and Interplanar Beacon, in order to consistently play your powerful spells. Overall, this deck aims to control the game and outvalue your opponent to secure the win.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of powerful Planeswalkers like Teferi and Tamiyo, along with efficient creatures like Wildgrowth Walker and Merfolk Branchwalker. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up a board presence and gaining incremental advantage. The deck also includes Command the Dreadhorde as a finisher, allowing the player to bring back multiple threats from the graveyard at once. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to outvalue the opponent and take control of the game through a combination of control elements and strong card advantage.

This Esper Control deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to control the game and generate card advantage. It includes a mix of counterspells like Absorb and Dovin's Veto, sweepers like Kaya's Wrath and Cry of the Carnarium, and removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Tyrant's Scorn to deal with threats. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Chemister's Insight and Search for Azcanta to help maintain resources and out-value opponents in a long game.

This deck focuses on using disruptive spells to control the board while playing aggressive creatures to pressure the opponent. By combining efficient removal like Thought Erasure, Tyrant's Scorn, and Deputy of Detention with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Sorin, Vengeful Bloodlord, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and establish a strong presence on the board. Thief of Sanity and Hero of Precinct One provide additional value and threats to overwhelm the opponent. The mana base is built to support a mix of white, blue, and black spells with efficient dual lands.

The deck focuses on aggressively playing threats like Hero of Precinct One, Thief of Sanity, and Hostage Taker, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought Erasure and Despark. It also has a mix of removal spells like Mortify and Tyrant's Scorn to control the board. The deck can also generate value with planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Sorin, Vengeful Bloodlord. The mana base allows for smooth casting of spells and enables a consistent game plan of applying pressure while disrupting the opponent.

The main concept of this Esper Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Hero of Precinct One and Thief of Sanity, while also utilizing disruptive spells like Thought Erasure and Tyrant's Scorn to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler for added value and card advantage. The deck aims to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid, while setting up a strong board presence with Wildgrowth Walker and Jadelight Ranger. Utilizing powerful removal spells such as Assassin's Trophy and Casualties of War, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Carnage Tyrant and Massacre Girl provides additional threats and ways to close out games efficiently. Additionally, cards like Vivien Reid and Nissa, Who Shakes the World offer additional value and card advantage for a strong and aggressive gameplay.

The main goal of this deck is to exert early pressure on the opponent with cost-efficient creature plays, backed up with removal spells and versatile planeswalkers to control the board. The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana while disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Casualties of War. Key creatures like Wildgrowth Walker and Carnage Tyrant provide a strong threat on the board, while the combination of Nissa and Vivien Reid provide card advantage and additional mana to overwhelm the opponent. The goal is to gain board control and beat down the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on ramping up mana with Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid to quickly play strong threats like Carnage Tyrant and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. Vivien Reid and Assassin's Trophy provide removal options, while Casualties of War can swing the game in your favor by destroying multiple types of permanents. The deck also includes creatures like Wildgrowth Walker and Jadelight Ranger to gain incremental advantage and pressure the opponent. Overall, the key concept is to ramp quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and disruption.

The deck focuses on using a combination of planeswalkers and control spells to dominate the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Narset, and Sarkhan, along with control spells like Shock, Spell Pierce, and Deafening Clarion, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Fblthp, Mox Amber, and Interplanar Beacon also provides additional card advantage and mana acceleration to further solidify the deck's control strategy and ultimately secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing planeswalkers to control the game by interacting with the opponent's board and hand, while also providing card advantage and gaining incremental value over time. It aims to establish a dominant board presence with powerful planeswalker abilities that can generate card advantage and control the game. The deck also includes efficient removal spells and countermagic to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own planeswalkers. The mana base is designed to support the diverse color requirements of the deck's spells and planeswalkers.

The key concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly with cards like Wilderness Reclamation and Growth Spiral, while using cards like Nexus of Fate and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales to continuously take extra turns. The deck aims to control the game by repeatedly casting powerful spells and preventing opponent's threats from resolving using counterspells like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also utilizes card draw and lifegain to maintain resources and stall the game until it can win through overwhelming advantage and inevitable combos.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible using low-cost creatures and powerful burn spells. With a heavy emphasis on utilizing cheap, efficient spells like Lightning Strike and Shock, combined with creatures like Goblin Chainwhirler and Viashino Pyromancer, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Light Up the Stage and Experimental Frenzy helps to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent throughout the game.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent using low-cost creatures and efficient burn spells. By constantly pressuring the opponent with fast creatures like Fanatical Firebrand and Goblin Chainwhirler, while also dealing direct damage with spells like Lightning Strike and Shock, the goal is to quickly bring the opponent's life total to zero. The inclusion of cards like Runaway Steam-Kin and Experimental Frenzy allows for fast mana generation and card advantage, ensuring a relentless assault on the opponent until the game is won.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with quick and aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Viashino Pyromancer, Goblin Chainwhirler, and Runaway Steam-Kin, along with a plethora of burn spells such as Shock and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to deal damage to the opponent's creatures and directly to their life total. With cards like Chandra, Fire Artisan and Experimental Frenzy providing additional card advantage and damage output, the deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of low-cost, high-impact burn spells and creatures. By combining efficient creatures like Viashino Pyromancer and Goblin Chainwhirler with powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of Experimental Frenzy and Light Up the Stage ensures a steady flow of resources and allows for explosive turns, while Chandra, Fire Artisan provides additional card advantage and a potent late-game threat.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively deploy low-cost creatures and burn spells to whittle down the opponent's life total quickly. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Goblin Chainwhirler while continuing to deal damage with efficient creatures like Viashino Pyromancer and Runaway Steam-Kin. Additionally, cards like Light Up the Stage and Rix Maadi Reveler provide card advantage to keep the pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck focuses on fast, proactive plays to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

This deck focuses on maximizing early damage output with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. By efficiently using low-cost spells and creatures, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a comeback. The inclusion of cards like Experimental Frenzy and Chandra, Fire Artisan provides additional card advantage and late-game reach to ensure the deck can maintain its aggressive momentum.

The main concept of this deck is to establish a fast and aggressive playstyle using creatures from the Selesnya colors. The focus is on generating token creatures through cards like Legion's Landing and Saproling Migration, and then utilizing them for powerful plays such as March of the Multitudes and Conclave Tribunal. The deck also incorporates powerful standalone creatures like Gideon Blackblade and Trostani Discordant for additional impact. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with an army of creatures and efficient removal options, while maintaining a solid mana base with a mix of forests and plains.

The main idea of the deck is to control the game by ramping up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Llanowar Elves, as well as utilizing powerful creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Jadelight Ranger. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with removal spells like Blink of an Eye and Blast Zone, while also utilizing planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Nissa to generate card advantage and create powerful board states. The deck also has the ability to take extra turns with Nexus of Fate, allowing for extended control and domination of the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing its mana ramp capabilities with cards like Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid to quickly play powerful creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Wildgrowth Walker. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive spells like Command the Dreadhorde and Hostage Taker, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and card advantage. Tamiyo, Collector of Tales and Nissa, Who Shakes the World provide additional card draw and ramp, solidifying the deck's ability to maintain its tempo and pressure the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through card advantage and countering opponent's threats while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation and Search for Azcanta. It aims to generate multiple value through card draw and direct damage spells, ultimately creating a lock on the game with the combination of powerful planeswalkers like Narset and Ral. The deck also includes versatile removal options to handle a variety of threats and has efficient mana fixing to ensure consistency in casting its spells.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the board through a combination of removal spells and powerful Planeswalker cards. By utilizing cards like Negate, Cast Down, and Vraska's Contempt to deal with threats, as well as utilizing cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Thought Erasure to disrupt the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to outvalue its opponent and generate card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Enter the God-Eternals and Karn, Scion of Urza provide additional win conditions and card advantage, making it a versatile and powerful control deck.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board through removal spells and counterspells while also disrupting the opponent's hand with discard effects. The deck aims to maintain board advantage and card advantage by using planeswalkers like Liliana, Dreadhorde General and Narset, Parter of Veils. The win condition is to either overwhelm the opponent with God-Eternal Kefnet and Enter the God-Eternals or to use a combination of planeswalkers and removal spells to grind out the opponent. The deck's mana base supports a variety of spells and abilities to maintain control throughout the game.

The deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with low-cost aggressive white creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Legion's Landing and History of Benalia to generate tokens, combined with Venerated Loxodon for a powerful pump effect. Teferi, Time Raveler provides control and protection for the board, while cards like Conclave Tribunal and Tomik, Distinguished Advokist help deal with threats. The goal is to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game, utilizing the synergy between small creatures and powerful buffs to secure victory.

The deck focuses on flooding the board with low-cost creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Adanto Vanguard, Skymarcher Aspirant, and Legion's Landing provide early aggression, while Benalish Marshal and Venerated Loxodon buff the team. Dauntless Bodyguard and Law-Rune Enforcer protect key creatures, and History of Benalia generates token creatures for extra pressure. Gideon Blackblade and Teferi, Time Raveler offer utility and disruption. The mana base allows for a consistent curve of aggressive plays, with a mix of white creatures and spells to maintain pressure and control the tempo of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly flood the board with small, white creatures known as "weenies" and use various cards like History of Benalia and Legion's Landing to generate value and pressure the opponent. Gideon Blackblade and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional support and disruption, while cards like Venerated Loxodon and Benalish Marshal pump up the team for strong attacks. With a low mana curve and aggressive playstyle, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient offense.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with low-cost, aggressive white creatures. By utilizing cards like Legion's Landing and History of Benalia to generate tokens, along with strong support from cards like Venerated Loxodon and Benalish Marshal, the deck aims to rapidly build a wide board presence. With protection from cards like Conclave Tribunal and Adanto Vanguard, along with disruption from Teferi, Time Raveler and Law-Rune Enforcer, the deck can apply relentless pressure and maintain control of the battlefield, ultimately leading to victory through sheer numbers and strategic plays.
